title: Find fossils of a bygone era
review: This place has fossils a few million years old when it was an ocean there. Unbelievable! ask an archaeologist.

title: Must visit place when at Jaisalmer
review: This fossil park is situated on Jaisalmer- Barmer Highway , it's a part of Desert National Park. Worth place for students and serious travellers. Roads inside the park are in very bad shape, needs maintenance.

title: once in a life time opportunity
review: Not an oft visited place. But should not be missed by those who practically wish to see the fossils which all of us read about in our middle school.

title: Yes, there are fossils but nothing much to do
review: They dont have animal fossils, it is wood fossils. Wood that has been fossilised millions of years ago and is now excavated. They have identified these pieces and have kept them preserved. The gate-keeper doubles up as the guide if you give him a tip and woudl explain everything there is about this place.

title: Historical Geography...
review: Traveling through ages, Fossils reflect the bygone climate of Desert which must have been lush green. 4 Emus roaming through the park are friendly but distinctly out of place

title: OK as a passing of time
review: Drive out to nowhere, pay Rs20 each and drive along a rocky path to some caged tree fossils. The most interesting thing was the aggressive emu at the front gate! Something to do, but just.

title: Wow
review: If you love to know old place details and stuffs this is the place. Very very old woods and all those details are available.

title: Unexpected
review: We went there expecting a lot of varieties to explore but were taken a back by the poor maintenance and collection!

title: Unique Fossil Park
review: The Akal Wood Fossil Park is located on the Jaisalmer Barmer Highway about 15-20 mins drive from Jaisalmer. One gets to see some well preserved wood fossils here which is difficult to see anywhere else in India. The park keeper also has a few emus which roam around the park.

title: Akal Wood Fossil Park
review: just loved this place, Akal Wood Fossil Park, located in jaisalmer. there is so much old stuff for see and their details is also available there. different place from other places.

title: A Different Kind of Place and not Frequented by Tourists
review: This is one tourist destination in Jaisalmer which has hardly got any visitors. It is basically an area where wooden fossils have been discovered and the area cordoned off and converted to a fossil park. Some of the fossils have been collected together and put up for display. It is located about 18 kms from Jaisalmer and one needs to have their own car or taxi to reach this place. An interesting and a different kind of experience.

title: Its beyond history
review: Yeah dear friends its beyond history. Here 180miliions old or more than that old tree trunks are preserved. near about 17km from jaisalmer city.

title: A must for visitors
review: One can see 18 fossils spread over the park. The fossils are 18 million years old wood fossils, preserved by nature. A must for students and interested people.

title: History Revisited
review: Nice place if u are interested in fossils, but very few visitors. Wooden fossils more than millions of year old are preserved here

title: Perfect offbeat destination for Explorers...
review: Fabulous place if you are interested in Fossils and Archaeology or history lover...

title: Bird Watching
review: Even thought I was Bird Watching and looking for one species that likes the habitat here it was great to see these fossil trees.

title: Not for an average person
review: If you have deep interest in history  or you have interest or understanding of fossil science then you can take plunge to visit this place.

title: Amazing fossils
review: This park is 18 Kms from the Jaisalmer Fort car park. The road till the park is good, takes you 20 minutes to reach.

title: Wood Foosil park at its best
review: This wood fossil park displays the wood fossil of 180 million years old.History buff will definitely love this place.Some of the fossil include the remains of a forest which has submerged in the sea.

title: A wood fossil park less known
review: The wood fossil park of Akal is not known to many - in fact very few know about it. This park contains 180 million year old wood fossils i.e. what you see over there is 180 million years old ...just imagine! It is also reminiscent of the fact that what is a desert today used to be a Tropical forest once! This place would be of particular interest to paleontologists.

title: Worth visiting; if you have a guide
review: Without a guide to explain, there was'nt much to be understood by ourselves. The security guard cum timekeeper at the entrance helped with some interesting facts. with the pain of travelling around 15 km from the city, it would have been better if good guidance was provided; especially if you have growing children with you, who yearn to learn.

title: Old time thing
review: If your interest in fossil, than this is the very place for you, other wise you ill not find this interesting

title: Million years of scientific history
review: Facing apathy of govt..but nonetheless a great place of knowledge. A must visit place for students and science buffs.

title: “A Trip to 160 Million Years Ago”
review: Brilliant for someone like me who loved geology.This wood fossil park is some 15 kilometers away from Jaisalmer on Barmer Road. The total staff at the park is a watch man, who keeps the gate locked and you honking for some time shows up and very discouragingly informs you that entry will cost you Rs 50/- per adult Indian person

title: field trip to see fossilized trees
review: We hired scooters and it was a fairly straightforward and easy ride to this fossil park. There are some old reviews mentioning taciturn gatekeepers etc but all has changed for the better now. The entrance fee is very reasonable and the gatekeeper was enthusiastic and helpful.

title: Place to learn earth's geology
review: The place is great to learn some geology, with fossils dating 190 million years old. The place could have been better maintained. But the landscape is very different from surrounding places, with black rocks created by volcanic activity.

title: Rare experience of viewing Wood Fossils
review: Located 17 K.M. from the main Jaisalmer city near Barmer Road on NH-15. If you are done with history then Akal Fossil Park is the place to be. For, it takes you beyond History. It takes you back to the prehistoric Jurassic era, which is, hold your breath, 130 million years back! It is a fossil park where stood a forest 130 millions years ago. Then the area submersed in to the sea and the tree trunks got preserved in the form of fossils.

title: Must visit
review: This place has wood fossils of around 180 million years old. All the found fossils are covered to protect except few samples to show as a proof. The wood fossils are recovered in rock solid condition. Wood is as hard as the stone.

title: Way old !!
review: Do visit this park if you are interested in fossils. Some of the oldest fossils in world..about 18 crores years old..but needs better way to present them..no display boards explaining about how the fossils were found..please meet Mr.Surinder Singh (caretaker) in the park..one of the finest person explaining about the place and fossils..

title: Why don't we manage our history better
review: Brilliant for someone like me who loved geology (and was a Mining enginner for 2 LONG years)...However what felt bad to me was the lack of information..the place looks abandoned...no guides...not much details for people who want to know more...

title: Only if you have time to kill
review: We ended up here because we had time to kill on our last day in Jaisalmer and  our rikshaw driver kept recommending it (it's 17 km from  Jaisalmer after all). It was a pleasant enough ride down the Jaisalmer-Jodhpur highway. We were the only ones there and had to knock on the closed gate so that the caretaker of the place could let us in. We were greeted at the gate by two emu, who are apparently the resident mascots. The park covers a wide area. Only 12 fossils are identified a mad marked and guarded in enclosures. As other reviewers have said, there nothing by the way of detailed explanation of what these fossils represent. I guess its for students of geology, who (our rickshaw driver told us) come here in hordes in winter. I'd advise casual tourists to go here only if they completely run out of things to do and have time to kill.

title: Wood fossils beautiful experience
review: I was always interested in geography n geology so visit to this park was a must.but to my shock ,what I see is a huge place with only one security guard who charged us some fees to enter the park.when we asked him to be our guide he said ,you take a look n come ,il explain u..anyways I went n saw wood fossils kept in cage like thing..very sad fact of Rajasthan govt,they have such a precious  n rare fossil, there's no value to it. They can preserve it properly n develop the park,it's a good thing for school n college students to study .

title: time killing
review: it you have spare ,even then it is not worth to go and see it.if you have geological interest then may be it is interest for you

title: Good to see Fossils and Emu
review: When you enter the gates of this park you will be greeted by three friendly Emu's. The fossils here are 180 million years old. We loved to play with Emu and see the old fossils.
